Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: Cat T
Reviews.Content: This was a nice little hotel. It was a BIT noisy on Friday, but not at all on Saturday. It is a great, clean, nicely-furnished hotel. The bathroom was small, but well appointed and the room was REALLY small, but cozy and comfortable. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of ice machines...BUT it was convenient to EVERYTHING...I recommend it as a place for someone that doesn't plan on being in the room a lot...and wants to see DT Chicago sights. Take advantage of the basement lounge...nice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: ladybird2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. Rooms are a bit small but ok for 3days. Clean, quiet. Restaurant near the hotel is very good !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rating??”
Reviews.Author: NEAL P
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed by the ratings given for this hotel because it was not a pleasant experience. I was unaccustomed to the non-personal kiosk-style check in... but that was only a sign that things were only going to get worse. It was noisy...although it did settle down after the police were summoned. The bed was somewhat comfortable but the bed coverings furnished hardly seemed sanitary (just a slippery poly bedspread and top sheet)... and no, I am not a clean freak. Furnishings were cheap although they were functional...kind of reminiscent of cheap office furniture rather than hotel furnishings. One towel per person...which works for a guy, but where can I find a woman that uses one towel? Only customer service requiring any interaction with the staff was parking validation...and they managed to screw that up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Invstr
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Boutique Hotel with a good location in the Financial District. Just a few blocks from Union Station and the Sears / Willis Tower. Booked this hotel through Priceline and got an OK deal. I've had better deals in the past, but with priceline, it all depends on general availability during your desired stay. This was early December, on a Saturday night, so who knows... Again, have had better deals, but this was OK. Either way, I would not have any hesitation regarding this hotel and would stay here again. The rooms were set up for couples or business people w/ one queen bed. Also had a desk, chair and flat screen TV. The room was clean and very comfortable and will meet the needs of most "non-family" travelers. The rooms are on the smaller side, however, but are nicely decorated. You would not want to try to "squeeze in" kids in any way. The bathroom is smaller too, with a stand-up shower (no tub) and a single sink. There is a restaurant on site which is connected, but not associated with the hotel. The restaurant is part of the Elephant & Castle chain. Good selection of pub type food and beer. Parking is $35 for valet with in/out privileges, however it takes about 15-20 mins. for them to get your car pulled around. There is public parking decks w/i 2 blocks that charge $25 for 24 hours. I think the hotel valet uses one of these lots as their "base" which would explain why it takes them some time to get your car. The check-in/check-out process was easy using their automated kiosks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location”
Reviews.Author: EWATWC
Reviews.Content: Booked this to be in the Loop close to the Art Institute, Architecture Tours, Millenium Park, and still a walk away from River North restaurants. Convenience is rhe point. Otherwise a business spartan style, beds a tad too well worn. For a few nights stay you don't need a car though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great service, incredible price”
Reviews.Author: sandman65
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Central Loop hotel for a conference in Chicago and though my fellow attendees ayed 2-3 times what I did, my hotel had better amenities(free wireless internet, gym) and service than theirs. The location was very convenient, the staff friendly and the room clean and very well maintained. One of the best hotel experiences I have had in recent years,

Reviews.Title: “Dorm Room”
Reviews.Author: mwilliams505
Reviews.Content: Like many rooms in Chicago, this was small; nothing you can't work around. It was not well appointed and felt like a renovated dorm room. The room and bathroom were adequately clean but made me decide to take all of our meals off property. The staff was super helpful and friendly and I really like the availability of filtered water. Because of the quality of the rooms I would stay here again if I had to, but not by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: s s
Reviews.Content: Lobby is beautiful. Service at the front desk was great. Restaurant was adequate... nothing spectacular. Elevators were lightning fast. Rooms were small but workable with only two of us. The free water bottles were wonderful. The room service and cleaning service were both awesome as well. The walls between each hotel room were paper thin. A woman sneezed next door to us and we both were shocked at how loud it was. Decent hotel but you better cross your fingers that you've got quiet neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Natottawa
Reviews.Content: Great for business stay, right downtown, no fuss, clean, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it's Location! Central and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa-mareeC
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great... Exactly where we wanted to be, walked out the door and everything was right there or within walking distance. Service was great and it wasn't expensive! We would happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Small but great in every other way”
Reviews.Author: texasbrian
Reviews.Content: Not much to add here: Great hotel with cool amenities. Rooms tend to be small, but you've got everything you need: Comfy bed... TV if needed... FREE (!) wifi that's actually fast for a hotel (7Mbps down)... free purified chilled water near all elevators... automated check-in/check-out... business center with dedicated boarding pass printing... EXCELLENT location... Shares a property with Club Quarters. Not sure how that works out, since it's one building, but no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SusanDFW
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on several occasions when I have had business in Chicago. It's a really nice place to stay if you're looking for a comfortable, quiet room. The rooms are not large, but they're cute and cozy. There is filtered drinking water and clean bottles available on every floor at no extra charge. The staff are responsive when you call them and there's a restaurant right next door that serves great breakfasts! It's right near the Willis Tower and water taxi if you want to cruise over to the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid lower floors”
Reviews.Author: OLLIEATBONNYS
Reviews.Content: Male on reception late night check in very offhand and bordering on arrogant, did not offer upgrade, or tourist brochures, suggested we were not at the correct hotel even though we had confirmation paperwork . Our room on 3rd floor smelt of dust and cigarette smoke, the curtains especially were dirty and smelt and the bedlinen was thin and 3rd rate, and room was very small. We did not complain due to exhaustion, and the initmidating attitude of reception, but when on returning at 4pm after sightseeing the next day our room still had not received housekeeping, we requested an upgrade as there was a sign in the foyer advising of availability. For extra $20 per night we had a larger clean room with no odours, on a higher floor. Female reception staff, after upgrading, offered advise and brochures and were pleasant. Restaurant next to hotel very good meals at reasonable prices. Would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Rude, small, noisey”
Reviews.Author: Jordan L
Reviews.Content: title says it all. Staff was rude on check in and out, TV barely worked, when the door for the next room closed it shook my entire room.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient location for first-time visitors”
Reviews.Author: patricia_1057
Reviews.Content: My husband had wanted to visit Chicago for several years, so for his birthday in 2010, we decided to head out to Chicago. Having never been to Chicago before, and not knowing anyone who lived there, we were looking for somewhere that was a central location, clean, and most of all, great on a budget. This hotel was all of those things. The room isn't anything spectacular, but it was spacious, have a comfy bed, and a roomy desk where we could keep our lap top to check email sometimes. It didn't include breakfast - that would've been a nice treat before leaving for the airport. The location was perfect for us and we were close to everything! We recommend staying here if you're headed to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a young couple”
Reviews.Author: CosmoSurfer
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel is a right choice for active people, who want to walk around the city center, visit museums, shop and enjoy breathtaking Chicago views. It's not far away form Michigan Ave, Willis Tower, Art Institute, Buckingham Fountain e t.c. Around you could find some interesting places to eat (like Exchequer restaurant & bar, Grillroom on Monroe). Service: +We came at 11 am, checked in and immediately got the room, though the official check-in was at 3 pm. Reception stuff was very helpful recommending the restaurants and guiding through the city map. Concierge calls the taxi immediately upon your request. -Without any special notice they blocked on my CC more then $100 together with the room charge. After my question - explained that it's in case of "extras" in my room. Room: +Nice, big bed, comfortable pillows, very good work zone, clean and light restroom, efficient conditioning, highspeed WiFi. -No safe (only small boxes at the reception), wall view, permanent noise (corridor door slamming and outside construction).

Reviews.Title: “First Class for budget amount”
Reviews.Author: Eastharlem
Reviews.Content: I stayed July 2nd to July 5th and was extremely happy with my accommodations. It was clean, staff was polite and helpful and location is centrally located. I had the single room which was fine for me and really could have accommodated one additional person if necessary. Plenty of places to eat in the area; I caught public transportation the entire time I was there. A 24 hour seven 11 across the street for late snacks or other items. Wonderfully lounge in basement with great work out room and free bottled water on each floor. I could not believe I only paid an average of $105 per night for what I got. If I ever visit Chicago again, I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “They've thought of everything”
Reviews.Author: jeffHalifax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Central Loop Hotel for 4-5 days at the end of April 2011. It was one of those deals on Expedia where you don't know the name of the hotel until you pay, and I was very pleasantly surprised. It felt like the management had thought about what customers are looking for and then created it. Free washer and dryer including laundry soap, chilled water and empty bottles on every floor, free reliable high speed wireless, free printing to the business center from your room, fridge, microwave, the list goes on. The only thing my room did not have was a bathtub, but the shower was very nice. The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. There are plenty of good breakfast places in the neighbourhood. The location for trains or visiting the Art Institute was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but beware of the bums lurking on street corners”
Reviews.Author: StevieG489
Reviews.Content: Location - easy to get to from O'Hare Airport. Just take the Blue line on the CTA system which will take about 35minutes and cost $2.25. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from the subway exit. However, be prepared to be greeted by a bum standing on most street corners begging for money. Amenities - Starbuck's next door, 7-Eleven across the road, McDonalds 2 minutes walk away. There's also a few cafe's and restaurants located nearby. There's a couple of Walgreens close by as well. Checkin - very fast. They use an automated system which you insert you credit card into which finds your booking. It only takes 2 minutes and you are issued with a card key. Room - I had a small Queen room. It was reasonably clean apart from some of the staining on the walls (coffee spils / scuff marks) but the main things you look for, i.e. clean bedding and bathroom, were to a sufficient standard. There's a coffee maker and a folder of restaurant menus. Flat panel LG TV. Aircon controls on the wall. Free wi-fi internet that works well. Facilities - bottled, purified tap water available by the lifts. Free self-service laundry room on the 3rd floor including free detergent. There's also a small gym with running machines, steppers and some freeweights. I think it is temporarly located on the 3rd floor. Overall I cant really complain for $95 a night considering the location. Just dont expect any frills.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great start”
Reviews.Author: ambaust
Reviews.Content: Just checked in and so far i would say it is the worst room i have ever stayed in. The room spells like vomit and too much cleaning product to try and cover it. The hotel is booked out with no available rooms to change to. Hopefully after this repulsive night they will be able to change our room. But so far i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not one complaint”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJoe2011
Reviews.Content: Good value, clean, very helpfull staff, good location, good restaurant, stayed for our anniversary and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: NattyLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in March 2011. He was working in the states and i was travelling to meet him for a weekend away are we wanted a base which would be quiet enough to enjoy but close enough to everything to be convenient and this ticked both boxes. The room was a good size and very clean. We faced over the back courtyard so it was very quiet. The only slight complaint is that, whilst they provide tea and coffee facilities in the room it was lacking a couple of things - teaspoons for example! An only enough to make one of each. Other than that it was fine, very comfortable and secure as everything needed key card access. Close enough to walk most places and also need the El so had lots of options. The only thing this part of town lacks is decent places to eat! Would definitely recommend if you want a central location without the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in the heart of the Loop”
Reviews.Author: duucfho
Reviews.Content: I was headed to Chicago in June 2010 for the Taste of Chicago. Ideally, I wanted a hotel close to Grant Park so I could be near the action, as well as the nightlife after hours. I thought a downtown hotel would be out of my price range, till I found the Central Loop Hotel. The location is in the heart of the city. The hotel itself is clean, the staff friendly and accommodating, and the rooms were pretty good. It is not a 5-star hotel, but it is more than adequate. After all, I'm of the opinion that I don't travel just to stay in hotels. If I ever travel to Chicago again, I would 100% stay at this hotel, and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff !”
Reviews.Author: JetSet-Q
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel can not be beaten. Their advice was excellent, but mostly they were so friendly. The room was a bit small, and had no fridge but that was it. The location was great, and the hotel was in great condition. The staff make this hotel exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pleasure in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: I admit I wasn't sure what to expect. I needed a hotel room for a conference in Chicago and everything else in the vicinity was well in excess of $200 per night. I looked at the reviews and the photos of the tiny, tiny, room and figured, "What the heck?". I arrived in Chicago, took the blue line downtown, and walked two blocks to the hotel where I was pleasantly surprised! The lobby was clean, modern, and the staff friendly and helpful. I quickly checked in and went upstairs... the filtered bottled water was another great surprise (and one i've used every single night of my stay!!). The room is small - yes... but well laid out and perfectly adequate for me as a solo traveler. It is very comfortable and immaculately clean. There is a Starbucks in the same building, an Elephant and Crown pub downstairs, and a Potbelly's sandwich shop next door along with dozens of other restaurants within a few blocks. Great hotel, HIGHLY recommended! Thank you for a terrific stay!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDabbsRNC
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by paging through available listings on Expedia. I had walked by it before, but never stayed there. That is about to change! It was convenient to my (theater/opera) venues, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Business Hotel - No frills”
Reviews.Author: HGoldenH
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Central Loop Hotel. It is located in the Loop about 1.5 miles from Magnificent Mile but is was a few blocks to the train to O'Hare, The L and to Michigan Avenue, the Art Museum and Grant Park. The rooms are more like European size but very clean and the furniture was new. The bed and bedding was comfortable. I appreciated the free wi-fi. There was a station by the elevator on my floor with water bottles and chilled water. You could fill up there for cold, fresh water on the go. If you don't need all the extras of big name hotels but want a clean, business hotel and a great rate, the Central Loop is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: EmmaMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: Our daughter found us this hotel for a weekend in Chicago for my husband's 60th birthday/Roger Waters performance of "The Wall" at the United Center. We found the hotel to be wonderful and hope to return. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to upgrade to a "Junior Suite" which afforded us a larger room. Facilities were very clean, filtered water was a nice addition. We actually ate at the hotel restuarant, Elephant and Castle Pub for three meals and the food was reasonably priced, very tasty, and the service was excellent. The location was excellent, a short walk to the lakeshore and downtown attractions such as the Art Institute, the Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum and Milleniuam Park. We actually also walked to the Navy Pier area. We had taken the train to Chicago and walking distance from Union Station was only about a half mile. All in all, an excellent weekend and we look forward to returning to the Central Loop in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: faye57
Reviews.Content: Central loop is where this hotel is, right in the center of the city, near sights and transportation. The hotel is in a very old building, completely updated inside. The feel is upscale for the price. The rooms are not especially small, but there is not a lot of storage, since it is designed for solo business travelers, work desk and chair, computer hookups and power strip. if not travelling alone you may need to ask for extra towels. The staff is knowledgable, and for the most part helpful. There are inexpensive restaurants around, but they close at 7 or 8, because its in a business area. we were given a handicapped room, and noone could explain why. Otherwise very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, good price.”
Reviews.Author: goworldmtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Central Loop. It's very well located if you don't mind being further away from Magnificient Mile. Since we wanted to go to the Willis Tower, the Art Institute, do an architecture boat tour and be close to the El, it was perfect. The room are rather small but more than ok if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room. It was very clean. No bath but a large shower. Very powerful hairdrier. Pillows and the bedcover were very very confortable. We even had a fridge. And a big TV ( I assume it worked well but I didn't even have time to turn it on). The only thing is the thin walls. We were lucky and had quiet neighbours. But when I walked in the corridor, I could hear sometime what was going on in people's room. Security is good, you need your keycard to use the elevator. Check in is easy. Close to the El so it's easy to get to both airports. You can leave your luggage downstairs after check out time. Pub downstairs with ok breakfast. Nothing to complain about. It was perfect for us. Even a Starbuck on the corner and a 7/11 on the other corner. If you want to go shopping, State Street, which is 10 min away, has all the stores you need if you don't have time to go to the Magnificient Mile. I would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place!”
Reviews.Author: Ondrej_Pavla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect for eploring Chicago - it is very close to Sears Tower within the Loop. The rooms are clean and silent. Everything just OK. The only thing which was worse was the bathroom door, which do not make it a sound-proof place.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but missing a few things”
Reviews.Author: olwick
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Central Loop hotel in Chicago. Itâ€™s a very good value in a fantastic location, but there are also a few things you should know about. First, the Proâ€™s: â€¢ Great value, considering the rates in â€œThe Loopâ€� area of Chicago. I paid $99/night. â€¢ The location is perfect for exploring downtown. Itâ€™s right between the Art Institute and the Willis (formerly Sears) Tower. There are multiple restaurants and services within easy walking distance. â€¢ Free bottled water. The hotel really seems to take the â€œgreenâ€� theme seriously. There are empty water bottles on each floor with purified water dispensers for you to use as much as you want. â€¢ The furnishings are relatively new and nice. Not overly luxurious though. Iâ€™d say theyâ€™re somewhere between a Best Western and a Westin. â€¢ There are free computer workstations to use for printing out boarding passes (see note in Cons though) â€¢ The hotel itself is very secure. Key cards are needed to operate the elevators as well as enter your room. â€¢ The attached Elephant & Castle Pub. Very good food. Not a huge menu, but what there is is very good. Plus you get your room service from there. â€¢ Free large chess sets in the lobby and lounge. Cons: â€¢ No safe in the room. This was a biggie for me as I had camera equipment I would have put in there. I asked the front desk about whether they had safe deposit boxes for use. They said â€œYeah, we can, umm, rent them or let you use themâ€�. Not overly confident. When I pushed further, they said they didnâ€™t mean rent, they meant just use. I didnâ€™t use them though as their answer didnâ€™t inspire confidence. â€¢ The â€œFree wirelessâ€� is exceptionally slow. I was there for 5 days (4 nights). Some days it was just okay and others it was virtually unusable. Note: The front desk was once again no help in troubleshooting any issues either: The in room instruction card tells you what network to join, but what it doesnâ€™t tell you is that you need to open your browser (Safari, etc) and accept their terms and conditions every 24 hours to have access. It will look like you have a strong signal, but you wonâ€™t be able to access it until you do that step. â€¢ The free computers to print boarding passes can also be excruciatingly slow. We tried for over an hour to print 3 boarding passes. We got 2 printed then finally gave up. Each web page was taking 2 minutes or more to load, then often failed and we had to restart at the beginning. I donâ€™t know if this was temporary or what, because the wireless that night was also super slow. â€¢ There is only one ice machine in the hotel. Youâ€™ll need to go to the 3rd floor to use it. â€¢ The lowest category rooms (standard rooms) are VERY small. Iâ€™m talking cruise ship small. The bathroom was so small that when I sat on the toilet my knees were under the sink. No, Iâ€™m not kidding or exaggerating. My friends had both the next room category up, plus one had a suite. They were larger and Iâ€™d definitely recommend going for the higher categories (although the suite really isnâ€™t a suite as itâ€™s all one room) â€¢ No refrigerator in the lowest category rooms. â€¢ No fan in the bathrooms â€¢ No movie channels of ANY kind (HBO, Showtime, PPV (of any kind)) â€¢ Valet parking only, and the valetâ€™s donâ€™t know any restaurants in the area, so donâ€™t ask them. So the bottom line is whether Iâ€™d stay there again. The answer is yes, but only in one of the higher category rooms and only if there wasnâ€™t a hotel in that general neighborhood that had safes in rooms with a similar price. Tip: Your GPS probably won't work to get you to the hotel once you're nearby with all the tall buildings nearby. Be sure to have printed directions or a map. Hope that helps, Mark

Reviews.Title: “Super location, nice price.”
Reviews.Author: JulesKW
Reviews.Content: Needed an inexpensive place for a quick train trip in and out of Chicago. Central Loop was just a few blocks from Union Station and the price was much lower than other locations I'd checked. Rooms are small but the furnishings are compact and well designed so I did not feel cramped. The water bottle filling stations on each floor are a great idea. Location convenient for walking to anything in loop and there are el's and buses galore to get anywhere else. Found several cheap places to eat nearby. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A really good deal”
Reviews.Author: rvsherry
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the 4th of July. Was pleasantly surprised with amenities, comfort and convenience. Price was definitely right: liked the computer and printer use; comfortable and clean. Very pleasant about storing bags for later retrieval. Location was great; easy access to Union Station and to Chicago shopping and sights. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Right Down Town”
Reviews.Author: aibarra5
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, very clean. Free internet. No fridge- which makes having leftovers a challenge, the front desk very graciously offered to put it in their staff fridge and brought it to me later....however no microwave became the next challenge. Water bottle station on our floor was a nice touch, had fresh purified water whenever we wanted. The best thing about this hotel is that it is right downtown and a quick walk to the trains. Restaurant next door was good too. Everyone was extremely nice and we had a very great week.

Reviews.Title: “Good and practical, great rates”
Reviews.Author: touchofeurope
Reviews.Content: I found this trip on this site and I'm glad I did, it was a great choice. The rooms are smallish but comfortable, and since the trip was a Conference, I wasn't going to be here much anyway. Complimentary wireless access makes this an even better deal. The restaurant is OK but not great (room service through them was very unfriendly), but they have a Starbucks next door for breakfast as well. Conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean place, staff is just okay”
Reviews.Author: wigginsamerica
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel. For the price, it was a great, and very clean stay. The rooms aren't big, but it's downtown Chicago, so you're not going to find "big" unless you pay big. The staff, however, was helpful only in the sense of "do what it takes to get by." They were friendly enough and helpful enough, but they didn't exactly care either. I had a question about my bill (since the receipt didn't match my hotels.com reciept). The receptionist basically told me a bunch of prepared statements, and when I asked her what that meant, she didn't know, and I would have to contact hotels.com. Gee, thanks. PARKING: be careful. The self-park is two blocks away. Not a long walk, until you have to make it 3 times. When you check out, make sure to have the receptionist validate your parking ticket. They didn't mention anything, and when I got to the garage, it was over 1 and a half times the price you pay with validation. So I had to walk back, and then back again. Like I said, staff is fine, but they don't really seem to "care" about you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value”
Reviews.Author: mrs_wright07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on an impromptu trip to Chicago last weekend. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and it was just as enjoyable as other visits to Chicago where we have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel and the Intercontinental. This is a no frills hotel,and the hallways are a little small (think cruise ship), yet we had a nice room (not large, but bigger than cruise ship). We had prompt service in both check-in and check-out, and enjoyed the bottled water and free wifi. It's very close to the State Street shopping, the Art Institute, and Millenium Park.Our only complaint was the room was a little warm, so we turned the air up for a few hours, and when we returned a few hours later, housekeeping had turned it off. For business or tourism, this hotel is great. If you want luxury, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jezikah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a trip to Chicago in May to see the sites and visit some friends. We mainly chose this hotel for hte location and price. We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. The hotel was nice and tidy. The room was on the smaller side, but we were only there to sleep, so it was fine for us. We had a big window with a view of the street and other buildings. It's within walking distance to Sears (Willis) Tower and Millenium/Grant park. We took public transportation to Navy Pier, Wrigley Field, and the Field Museum/Aquarium. Very convenient to everything and easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Mangustena
Reviews.Content: This is an inexpensive hotel smack in the center of downtown. 10 min walk to Grant Park. 15-20 min walk to the beginning of the Magnificent Mile. The rooms are not huge, but a comfortable size - only the bathroom stands out as small (there is no bath, only a shower), but that wasn't a big deal for me. Everything you need is still there. The rooms are very clean. Temperature comfortable. Had no problem sleeping in this hotel, except that you could hear other guests slamming shut their doors, which actually startled me a couple of times. Oh, and the purified chilled water comes really handy! All in all I was very satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's just ok”
Reviews.Author: Amystravelabroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because of its great location and great price. At first we were given keys to a room that would not open. We had to go back downstairs. They assigned us to a different room. We believe that they actually sent us to a room that was already in use! As we were walking in the hallway to the room, I jokingly told my husband that it seemed that the side of the hallway that our room was on felt like it was an interior room and wouldn't have windows. Unfortunately, I was correct. Instead it had two large skylights by the doorway. (The original room we were assigned to would have had windows!) There was a control on the wall for blinds on the two skylights, but unfortunately it only moved the blinds for one of the skylights. The rest of the room was quite small with a double bed. The bathroom was fairly large, but it had a large shower with no bathtub. I felt like it was a giant version of a bathroom from a cruiseship. The double bed was quite uncomfortable, and the pillows were horrible. Neither of us slept well at all either night. The temperature of the room didn't help things either. I noticed in an earlier review that someone had problems with getting heat in the room. We had the opposite problem. We could not cool down the room. I even set the thermostat at 55 degrees, and it was still quite warm. The hallway outside the room was much cooler! I also saw other reviewers complain about hearing doors slamming all of the time. It was an annoyance for us too. We ate breakfast at the attached restaurant and had a very good experience there. Service was great, and the food was quite good. You can't beat the location and price, but you get what you pay for. The room was very clean, but I would be willing to pay more for a decent night's sleep. Even my back was sore for a couple of days after staying there! As I understand, this is also a Club Quarters, a place businesses use for clients. If I were a client staying there, I wouldn't be very happy with the business sending me there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: suzyq425
Reviews.Content: I traveled twice to this hotel, once in May with another couple and again in June with my boyfriend. It was quiet, had a restaurant downstairs., coffee makers, and ome have refrigerators and microwaves. Good stay

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay downtown but expect to walk or take a taxi”
Reviews.Author: Gidoctor
Reviews.Content: Close to most places but by taxi, if you want to only walk close distances stay on Michigan Av/Magnificent mile which is 2- 3 times more expensive. note, there is no breakfast. Also if you have a Mac or iphone, internet will take a while to get going but keep trying.

HotelInfo.Name: Central Loop Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 111 West Adams Street, Chicago, IL 60603
